website_summaries.verdict: While the affordable Sennheiser HD 205 II DJ Headphones provide good bass, natural sound, and capable performance, critical listeners may find them lacking acoustic flair.
pros: The Sennheiser HD 205 II DJ Headphones are comfortable to wear, even for long-term use, and their bass is exceptional for budget headphones
Noise leakage is minimal, and they shield ambient noise very effectively
The price is affordable, and a protective pouch is included
cons: The hard plastic design creaks after moderate use and the headset doesn't fold for storage
The attached single-sided cable may be too long for portable use, and there is no way of replacing the cable

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but low quality vinyl cups.
customer_reviews.text: Good: Nice deep bass and fidelity when using with a good source. I use an external Soundblaster Audigy USB sound card with the EQ software and couldn't' be happier. Bad: I bought my pair in November of 2013. The vinyl foam cups are already starting to fall apart into pieces. Plus, when I bought these new and took them out of their packaging, the smell of the vinyl was absolutely overwhelming. It had a very bad chemical smell to it that smelled up the whole apartment. After about a week, it finally started to clear up. Please start using better quality (and non-toxic) vinyl with this product, Sennheiser.
customer_reviews.author: LincolnRider

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is awesome for the price point but they're not comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound but these should have been designed as OVER the ear instead of on the ear. I wore them for 5 minutes and had to take them off. I'm a Dj and fortunately for me, I won't be wearing them over the top of my head but will have just the left one up next to my left ear so the design won't really cause me any problems. For someone buying these to actually wear for long periods of time, get something from Sennheiser that's an over the ear and you'll be much happier. The sound quality is awesome for the price point but the design is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Video Guy

customer_reviews.title: Might be fine for a DJ
customer_reviews.text: These were needed for classical music, and the quality of sound is not good enough for that. Amazon took them back and gave a refund, though, and that's much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser HD 205-II Studio Grade DJ Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews of previous purchasers before buying my own Sennheiser 205-ll Studio Grade DJ headphones. The sound quality is very good with the same negative as previously reported, too much pressure on the ears from the ear pads because of the slightly too tight headband. I've attempted to stretch the headband by placing the earphones over my easy chair's arm rest, for a prolonged period of time, without any appreciable relaxation of the headband pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Woolaway

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, poor design.
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty damn good in terms of sound quality. They do exactly the job I need them to do as an electronic music producer hobbyist. But, they are really uncomfortable and make my ears / side of head hurt after about 45 minutes (I don't even wear glasses). Also, they do this weird thing where the hair on the top of my head gets stuck to something in them and it gets ripped out almost every time I take them off - unless I wear them in a weird position all the time. Great sound, poor design. Hence the 3/5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these "refurbished" for about $25, when they arrived, they looked sealed, taped and brand new. The clamping tightness people complain about is a bit exaggerated. Stretch them out, put them on a ball overnight a few times and you will be fine. Only people with the biggest heads will complain and mine isn't small. Also, pull out the extender on the head band a bit and they wont hug your head as tight. Overall sound quality is good. I would say they are failry balanced with the highs, mids and lows. Bass is there, but nothing deep or textured. With a decent audio source, these are definitely good for the $50 price range.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: I bought this a a month ago, right now ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a a month ago, right now I'm getting an intermittent failure on the right side (sound comes on and off) is more likely a cable issue but come on after a month of regular use?, this is my second sennheiser product (frist being an HD-202) and got the same issue with those, of course i couldn't expect much from a $20 headphones but its very disappointing from a brand like Sennheiser , as for sound is ok, nothing to brag about, sound isolation is ok too.
customer_reviews.author: Juan R.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, not so comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones, but very snug fit. my head is large and I wear glasses, and after 15 mins or so wearing them my glasses are digging into my head form how snug they are. 5 star sound 1 star comfort level... hence the 3 star rating.... may have to sell them and try another set, not sure i can get them to sit comfortably on my head which is a shame, as the sound is excellent...
customer_reviews.author: Alesandra

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my weekly radio show as I didn't like sharing the studio set. They are comfy and nicely padded, easily adjustable, and the sound quality is very good. They came in their own drawstring carrying pouch, which makes it convenient to carry them back and forth with the rest of my radio gear. Definitely the best of the headphones I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: HaikuCat

customer_reviews.title: Tight Squeeze
customer_reviews.text: I know that a lot of other reviewers said that these where tight...But I kinda of have the impression that it was manageable. It is not. They are very uncomfortable. They do sound great and block out outside noise etc. But it does not good because you do not want to wear these for any length of time. I also have a pair of the 202s and they are amazing. they are comfortable, have a great sound. So my recommendation would be to buy the 202s. Then you will have everything.
customer_reviews.author: janke

customer_reviews.title: Good for music
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably good sound quality for (loud) rock music...etc. Cover your ears, but is not necessarily noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: DeepPurple

customer_reviews.title: These headphones sound great, however I returned mine because they are advertised ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great, however I returned mine because they are advertised as an over the ear headphone and they just didn't fit over my ears and were very uncomfortable for me. I wanted to keep them so bad but just couldn't. I guess from here on in I am going to have to try on my headphones before I purchase. The return process was very easy, and the company that sold them to me was very easy to deal with for the return.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Marek

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have fairly good sound. Not audiophile quality as the info may suggest, but overall its pretty good. Especially for about $26 which is what I ended up getting them for. I think the best thing about these is that the closed design is great if you dont want anyone else to hear what you are listening to. They are tight and the cans are smaller than most Sennheisers, and they can cause your ears to become sore after a couple hours of use, but after you get used to them and break them in they are not so bad. So these are pretty good cans on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Cory B

customer_reviews.title: This was the headphone set that sent me into a ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the headphone set that sent me into a head-fi whirlwind years ago. I was so impressed with them back then. Since then I've listened to a lot of different headphones. These are ok DJ headphones and they have a punchy bass but other than that are very overpriced even at $60.
customer_reviews.author: rastadolphin

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely best headphones for the money
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely best headphones for the money. I tried a few and found these on a lightning deal. Scooped them up. They don't say noise canceling but they might as well be. They pound and like any headphone if you wear them too long they start to hurt your ears but I found my limit was around 3 hours so unless your pulling a world of Warcraft marathon Big Bang theory style you should be fine
customer_reviews.author: CDietz

customer_reviews.title: Either this product is low quality or we got a bad pair. Unfortunately it is not eligible for return
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair for my son at xmas but soon realized they weren't being used because of the fact that one side is not producing sound or only occasionally blurts out sound. Either this product is low quality or we got a bad pair. Unfortunately it is not eligible for return.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: I nice upggrade fron the HD202
customer_reviews.text: I had the the HD202 and i liked those. I used them for listening to music while at work. However, I like the 1 cord and the option to swivel the right side of the headphones without taking them off. They feel comfy on my head for long periods of time. nice product
customer_reviews.author: Evil Pink Pony

customer_reviews.title: A little Tight
customer_reviews.text: Consistent with other reviews I do find this set a little tight however I have heard of people keeping them stretched out overnight or something and I will try that. The actual can could be a little larger to be more over the ear than on ear but for what they are I am relatively happy. Well worth the 30 bucks I spent to get a refurb pair. I wouldn't pay full retail for them though. Id probably be more apt to spend up to the HD280 pro..
customer_reviews.author: D m

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is good. Which is the only reason it gets 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good. Which is the only reason it gets 2 stars instead of one. Good God these are incredibly uncomfortable. They clamp down on your head very tightly. I can't wear them for even an hour before I have a headache and it feels like my ears have been pushed half-way through my skull. It doesn't matter what length adjustment I have them on either. I'm very unsatisfied with these. Don't buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headphone
customer_reviews.text: This is 3x better then the 202, for $20 more you can't go wrong with the 205. They are a little heavier due to a nice quality headphones. I have 70% hearing loss on my right side and I can hear many beautiful tones that you will not hear with a cheaper headset.
customer_reviews.author: Fratt

customer_reviews.title: Great set - exellent swivel feature - needs a bit of depth
customer_reviews.text: Great set. I like the fact that its not loosy-goosy at the ears. But, (which most don't know), the left ear peice does swivel a bit. So, you can put the earpeace on, and then twist the headphones accordinly to expose your right ear to the booth music. So, thats a feature that is really handy! My headphone jack doesn't support base and treble contols - so the headphones playing "flat" doesn't have a lot of depth. Thats the only bad thing. You need to have base and treble controls in order to add it to the headphones properly.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Hill

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good sound but too small for my big ears lol
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Decent entry level DJ headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have a well balanced sound, capture all the low frequencies popular in bass heavy electronic music. They are quite tight, so for guys like myself with a larger head (I guess that's what you get for being a dj, a big head) it can be a tight fit that can make it difficult for a long listening session. Although the sound isn't the best, for the price they are an excellent buy if you can't spend 100+
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: It produces decent sound, with a little less bass. The sound overall seems balanced with a little emphasis on high frequencies. Th ear padding is not comfortable so you can not wear it for long sessions. Moreover since I wear glasses, my ear hurt after sometime since these headphones press strongly against my ears. The length of cord is more than enough suggesting that these should be used in a static environment. The headphones feel just fine despite their plastic build.
customer_reviews.author: MUsama

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great! but too long
customer_reviews.text: these headphones are great they have a great sound variation and buying them used i could not tell them apart from new ones. the only fault i find with them is the cord is wayyy to long for regular everyday use just last week i almost ripped the cord on a truck, so i cut the cord and bought a new 3.5mm headphone jack and split the cord a soldered the new one in it actualy made them sound better in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: AMessofStalters

customer_reviews.title: disappointed because this isn't the only item from Sennheiser that ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought Sennheiser headphones and one side failed within 3 months. Very, disappointed because this isn't the only item from Sennheiser that did this. I previously bought a headset that looked similar to this one and that one failed too, on a single side.
customer_reviews.author: kit

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice head phones just need to try them put at a gig
customer_reviews.author: S3&HAPPY

customer_reviews.title: Great for audio mixing! Just what I needed! Why spend more, when these are all you need?
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these headphones just what I needed. Great for mixing audio and not being bothered by other noises around you. This is the 4th pair I've purchased. 2 for me and 2 for friends.
customer_reviews.author: GoMommyGO!

customer_reviews.title: Too big the jack
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are fine but they only plug into my old stereo. I was trying to get headphones for the computer. These don't fit, they are way too big at the plug-in element. I wish they had been described that way. I was caught unawares.
customer_reviews.author: international film fan

customer_reviews.title: Silence is Golden
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of phones I have ever purchased. Cancels outside noise and provides excellent sound quality. Lightweight yet sturdy and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: WhW

customer_reviews.title: Poor Bass Response
customer_reviews.text: The headphones do fit tight, but that's not really an issue. The issue was the poor bass response, and the highs were not that great either. I prefer the HD 202's.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: lasted 9 months
customer_reviews.text: They lasted 9 months then kaput. That's with daily use but for 80 bucks i'd expect them to hold up...
customer_reviews.author: JohnyMac

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what went wrong but headphones would only play ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what went wrong but headphones would only play music but no words. Never had that happen before. Tried 4 different devices with no luck. Returning for refund
customer_reviews.author: quiltnmama2

customer_reviews.title: Just get the 202's
customer_reviews.text: I decided to spend a little more this time, and get the 205's, after several years with the 202's. The 205's are less comfortable and keep the same level of noise cancelling, and sound quality is only barely noticeably better. There's nothing wrong with these headphones, and they've help up pretty well for the few months that I've had them - but next time, I'm going back to the 202's, which I prefer and cost half as much.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Sound But Not Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound, but the ear pads are over ear and uncomfortable as they are ridiculously tight. The cord is pretty long too. Bought these for my 10 year old brother, he likes it except for how long the cord is.
customer_reviews.author: David Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and ability
customer_reviews.text: If you were looking for great headphones at a decent price. These are what you're looking for. They may be a bit tight, but if you look in these reviews, there is a part requisition for soft ear pads that loosen it up. The sound is amazing and the headphones can certainly blast music if you want them to. Although they aren't meant to totally block noise, that's what happens when you start listening to music at decent levels.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, slight discomfort
customer_reviews.text: Overall there are very nice headphones, but like other reviewers have said they can be tight. At first they are really tight but by leaving them stretched out on something like a computer case overnight they gradually loosen up. I have found that if you don't leave them stretched out every night they return their original position. Also after wearing them for 3-4 hours they can start to irritate your ears. For the price paid and sound quality you get I can easily recommend them to someone else, just be weary how you store them.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Durso

customer_reviews.title: Work Horse Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These were referred to me by an audio engineering buddy of mine. They work great; low end and mids are balanced well. Hi end not too bright on the ears. Very comfortable fit. I run an audio console every week and use them for recreational purposes too. I've owned Sony's at $125, Sennheiser's at $150 and would recommend this to anyone wanting a solid set of headphones for professional and recreational purposes.
customer_reviews.author: J.Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable set
customer_reviews.text: Easy on the ears physically, good sound reproduction, able to use both size headphone sockets. May be "better" sets out there (I doubt it) but these do not require a large loan to purchase. We use these for monitoring audio during video recording sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Oldtimer

customer_reviews.title: ... little tight on the ears but the sound is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: a little tight on the ears but the sound is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: TYA Alisa ANTHONY

customer_reviews.title: good earphones
customer_reviews.text: I needed some earphones to listen to content on my computer while my daughter's family was watching something on TV that I wasn't interested in. While these earphones don't have as much sound-blocking as I wanted, they have such a good sound quality (compared to my old earbuds!) that I am very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: ablink

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, a little snug
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these I was worried I'd have to return them because of the snug fit. Thankfully, I stuck with them, and they loosened up nicely. I didn't try the trick with the basketball or books, but I'm sure that couldn't hurt. Anyway, they sounds really nice. Clear highs and mids, pretty strong bass. As long as you can put up with a snug fit you get great sounding headphones that do a pretty good job of noise isolation.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for the price, only problem is to be careful with the dj side that bends up. once that breaks it will remain loose after.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted a noise canceling head phone for work. They are comfortable, but a little tight. Hoping that they stretch out the more I use them. I would recommend them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is great, but as other reviewers have stated
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great, but as other reviewers have stated, the fit is quite tight. I ended up selling them to a co-worker because it got to be too painful to wear them over my glasses. He's enjoyed them since!
customer_reviews.author: M. Adams

customer_reviews.title: ... for a living and these headphones are much more comfortable than the in the ear kind and the sound ...
customer_reviews.text: I do transcription for a living and these headphones are much more comfortable than the in the ear kind and the sound quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: AzDeeDee

customer_reviews.title: padding coming off
customer_reviews.text: I just tried these on today and was pleased with the quality. I have a large head and the cushion on top started to detach.
customer_reviews.author: Kyo0013

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but a little too tight.
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of this, but be aware that it is a *very* tight fit. My wife is a voice-over talent, and she liked everything about the headset except for hot tight it squeezes her head.
customer_reviews.author: Justin R

customer_reviews.title: impressive sound, but a bit tight
customer_reviews.text: First off, let me just say that these sound incredible. The bass is deep but doesn't smother the mids or highs. They are great for all kinds of music. But if you have a large head, you may have issues. The head band is very tight but can be fixed by putting them around a basketball for a while. But altogether they are incredibly well built and the sound is awesome. Definately worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: naismo96

customer_reviews.title: You cannot go wrong with Sennheiser! But from the ...
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong with Sennheiser! But from the pictures I was under the impression that both sides of the headphones rotated. Only the right side rotates forward and back.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Great step up from earbuds, comfort could be better.
customer_reviews.text: So, I've been in earbud land all my life and decided to upgrade. Totally worth $50. Everything just sounds clearer, more open, and sounds you haven't heard before kind of come to the surface. That being said, they could be a little more comfortable. They're a tad tight, and the cups seem small for circumaural. The tightness can be solved by leaving them on something overnight (I used my paintball mask :]) and the cups aren't uncomfortable, just not quite circumaural. All in all I like them, and they sound nice. They could just be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: superpeda

customer_reviews.title: but I can say that I'm pretty happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert in audio related subjects, but I can say that I'm pretty happy with this purchase, the overall build quality of the headphones is great, and the sound is just awesome. Delivery was on time and everything was in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Milandrei

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, could go a little louder on some mixers though
customer_reviews.author: nigel reid

customer_reviews.title: Dad the DJ
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dad who does DJing on the side. I tried them out after he opened them and they were comfortable to wear and had really nice sound quality. I know he really likes them too.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The headphone jack broke in less than one week after I got them. It’s inflexible and easily shorted. Only one headphone works
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound it gives. I hear every kind of music, from avicii to iron maiden and love the bass sounds in every song. The only thing is that they are a little bit too tight... The first days they were uncormfortable after an hour of using them... now I am more used to them and I tend to use them for longer periods without any problem. Really great quality-price ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Ramiro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love my Headphone well not trade for nothing I think they are better than headphone beat.
customer_reviews.author: james lastrap

customer_reviews.title: gift for husband who is a Disc jockey
customer_reviews.text: He is pleased with the sound and fit no complaints so far, would recommend for others to give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: NBeck

customer_reviews.title: Headphones are Great
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. Good sound quality. Not really happy with the wire. Would like to have seen a coiled wire used instead of a long straight wire
customer_reviews.author: dj pete

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good
customer_reviews.text: The headphones do sound good. The ear cushions are nice but the headband is very tight. After awhile they become uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good but ears become tired easily, they are not really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clear, Consise and Capable
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are the latest in what's becoming a long line of mid-priced computer phones. I'm not an audiophile but require a level of quality that is above most. These meet that level. I haven't owned them long enough to be certain but everything I've experienced so far leads me to think this might be the "last set" I need to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Whitten

customer_reviews.title: ... a little uncomfortable the sound quality is not the best but are good for the
customer_reviews.text: ok headphones but are a little uncomfortable the sound quality is not the best but are good for the price
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones and an added bonus
customer_reviews.text: Sennheiser always brings their A game and these headphones are great. I especially appreciate a neat pouch for carrying the headphones around!
customer_reviews.author: Cari (Des Moines)

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. The coard is a bit short
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. The coard is a bit short. Nice sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Priced right and sound is great for casual listening to music
customer_reviews.text: Priced right and sound is great for casual listening to music...sadly ordered two and one came in broken :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, great sound, long cable, it comes with a nice leather cover :D Got here on time, what else can i say... They're awesome!!! Recomended
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Pepen

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: love the quality of the sound, really eliminates outside noise.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Henry

customer_reviews.title: These head phones took my Radio Show to Another Level!
customer_reviews.text: My new head phones are great! I use them on my radio show and my clarity has Gone to another level.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Something isnt right
customer_reviews.text: My friend got these same headphones from best buy about a year ago and I loved the way they sounded. But when mine came in they didn't hardly have any good sound quality. bass was not like advertised or like my friends. highs were present but nothing great and mids were below average. I will be sending them back today.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Nation

customer_reviews.title: Worked great...for a while
customer_reviews.text: The headphones worked great when I first recieved them. It has great sound in both the treble and bass frequencies. Unfortunately, within the first three months they stopped working, not playing lower frequency sounds due to damage to the headphone jack. I didn't treat them roughly, and I've had pairs of headphones that have lasted for much onger. Sennheisser, when we asked for a fix under warranty, told us to go back to the original vendor. Luckily it was Amazon, and they took great care of us as always. Amazon, you rock. Sennheisser, better customer service is expected these days.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: concise review
customer_reviews.text: Comfort 0/5 -Hurts within minutes of wearing. Very Tight. Portability 1/5 -The cables are very very long and heavy. Good luck fitting them into your pocket! Sound Quality 3/5 Bass is tight and strong, but Mids and Lows are weak. Medium level of detail and clarity. Frequency range is low. I paid $24. It could have been worth the money if the comfort was higher.
customer_reviews.author: Igf

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Not as comfortable as I hoped. They are really tight fitting, been trying to stretch them, and its slowly getting better. Cord would be better if it curled, it seems to get wrapped, and knotted at times. Overall, i would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L****

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser HD205
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product with great sound quality especially for the study or for professional dj. A globally recognized brand. I would not hesitate to buy some headphones as reliable as these!
customer_reviews.author: dranlex

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these headphones. Built sturdy and the sound is phenomenal. Good bass and mid. They could use a little more in the highs range.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Good headset!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, really like the swinging earphone for ambient sound and communications. I would recommend this headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and familiar. #Settling.
customer_reviews.text: They're not the best headphones, but they were exactly the pair I was looking for to replace my old ones that got chewed up by a cat about 5 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item and seller
customer_reviews.text: The item is fantastic, was even better than I thought. The description doesn't made justice to the item, because it looks completely new if I would have receive the item in a box I would have thought it was new. Besides it work perfectly excellent sound quality and it's very comfortable I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Abjer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. A little to tight tho. But still great studio head phones.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my girlfriend. she got a bunch of new recording equipment and these headphones work great as a beginner recording studio quality. Came with different size adapters. Great noise cancellation!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my nephew that he's using it at the radio station, he loves it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Luk12

customer_reviews.title: thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: It's been a while since my headphones broke, so finally I've decided to find a replacement. Browsing through Amazon I've read a hundred reviews for Sony, Audiotechnica and finally Sennheiser. Well, what can I say - I'm happy I bought Sennheiser. Got a good price for nice quality. They're comfortable for long listening, sound is clear, bassline sounds good, and noise from outside doesn't bother you once you wear them. The cord is long (good for those who use it with a PC like me). Overall - I'm happy with my choice and definitely recommend this item for those who look for inexpensive and good quality headphones.
customer_reviews.author: dd

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking audio engineering courses and they recommended this. It sounds crisp and for it's price, I think this is the best anyone who doesn't want to break their wallet, can do.
customer_reviews.author: Shad

customer_reviews.title: ... not longer works in the left ear and sounds like right ear is on the way out
customer_reviews.text: it is too tight and after using it for 2 months it not longer works in the left ear and sounds like right ear is on the way out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Hennen

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound!
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these is amazing and they are very comfortable... eventually. They came wrapped tightly which made them curl a lot. We put them around a ball to stretch them out and they are much better now.
customer_reviews.author: Megan S.

customer_reviews.title: decent sound i was looking for better but these are
customer_reviews.text: decent sound i was looking for better but these are ok
customer_reviews.author: rick shaw

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Broke after about 3 weeks of pretty light use, audio stopped coming through the left ear. Pretty frusterating.
customer_reviews.author: Torsten Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Headphones Review
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have excellent sound quality. Everytime I listen with them it's like I hear whole new sounds even if I've heard the song or audio already. I highly recommend Sennheiser's to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Banan14kab

customer_reviews.title: Great Phones
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these headphones, love the sound, a great balance of bass and high end, very comfortable on the head.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest E. Vansaw

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN BEATS  BY DRE AND CHEAPER
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT. These headphones are cheaper and better than my beats by dre
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hill

customer_reviews.title: would recommend using a stand to break in the head band
customer_reviews.text: Got mine on sale for $30 and well worth every penny. That being said, these aren't exactly premium. You just aren't paying for fashion. Also very stiff, would recommend using a stand to break in the head band, but they never really get perfectly comfortable, just tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: William Gracia

customer_reviews.title: not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: These cans sound like cheap cans from Walmart. The hd203s sound much better. I really surprised by this. what a ley down.
customer_reviews.author: Perry L Walker jr

customer_reviews.title: Great price, better quality.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well priced for a high quality product. Sound is very crisp and I recommend this for any Dj who is low on cash.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Im not a headphone expert or anything like that but these are very good headphones, they keep the noise out, and your music in (which was very important), one bad thing is the cable is very long and thin which can be a nuisance but it is fine if you have a holder. Overall a great pair of headphones and i would recommend these for anyone on a smallish budget.
customer_reviews.author: Finn Arends

customer_reviews.title: You guys have big heads.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit here and love the quality of music that is coming out. It makes me a very happy person.
customer_reviews.author: Britton Pringle

customer_reviews.title: Take heed about the size of these.
customer_reviews.text: I can't wear these for more than 15 minutes with pain in my jaw from the massive amount of pressure that these poorly engineered headphones use to "block out outside sound." They sound ok but are sized for a child. The ear cups do not seal in the front and the cups only pivot about 10 degrees. Only one side has the pivot hinge. Very disappointed and will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Bingaman

customer_reviews.title: Senneiser HD 202's were better
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace my Sennheiser HD 202's which I broke, since they no longer sell those. In my opinion the sound and fit is not as good. Also does not come with a clip to wind up the extra cord like the 202's yet costs so much more
customer_reviews.author: whizmo76

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Can't wear longer than 20 minutes very tight... leaves your ears sore for at least a day. Good for very small adult heads or children..
customer_reviews.author: Blessed!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound and powerful Bass
customer_reviews.text: I bought them and I think an excellent product, the price is very good for the quality of headphones, fulfilled and exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, flimsy design.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is excellent, as with all Sennheisers. Ear pads a bit too small for my ears, and they squeeze my head, making them very uncomfortable. Worst though is that they came with a defective swivel joint on the left phone. Even without that defect, the joint seems very flimsy. I'd recommend getting one of the solid strap models. HD 202-II is a much better pair of headphones for ~ half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Metalheck

product_meta.title: Sennheiser HD 205-II Studio Grade DJ Headphones (Black/Grey)
product_meta.description: Studio-grade, detailed audio with incredible reproduction of frequencies high to low; Sennheiser's HD205 II headphones offer brilliant shielding of ambient noise to keep out unwanted distraction from your listening experience. Featuring a rotatable ear cup, comfortable earpad connection and single-sided cable; the HD205 headphones are pro-level option for both DJ's and home recording. Sennheiser HD205 II Features Rotatable padded ear-cup for comfortable, single-ear listening Perfect for DJ or studio use Outstanding shielding of ambient noise Hypo-allergenic earpads are field-replaceable and easy to clean Rugged construction takes a beating on the road Dynamic, smooth audio reproduction with deep bass extension Protective pouch and 1/4 inch adapter included Built-tough with a 2 YEAR warranty. Unlike competitive models, the earcup rotates while maintaining earpad contact on your head for stability and comfort without leaking noise into adjacent microphones. The HD205 II comes with a convenient protective pouch and locking 1/4 inch adapter for storage and transportation. AmericanMusical is an authorized dealer of Sennheiser products.
feature_bullets: Best rotatable ear cups for DJ's
Earpads are field replaceable and easy to clean
Smooth audio reproduction with deep bass
Rotable padded ear cup for comforatable single ear listening
Perfect for DJ or studio use
Rugged construction takes a beating on the road
Includes protective storage pouch for safe transport
